    • Method Detail

      • getCreditCardTransFraud

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCreditCardTransFraud(java.util.List<java.lang.String> transactionInputList,
                                                                       java.util.Date transDate,
                                                                       double treshHoldPrice)
        Produces a list of hashed credit card number that have been identified as fraudelent. From the given list of credit crad transaction A credit card will be identified as fraudulent if the sum of prices for a unique hashed credit card number, for a given day, exceeds the price threshold treshHoldPrice.
        Parameters:
        transactionInputList - a list of comma separted string that holds the credit card transactions, a credit card transaction is comprised of the following elements;
               *
        • hashed credit card number
          •      *
        • timestamp - of format yyyyy--MM-ddThh:mm:ss
          •      *
        • price - of format dollars.cents
          • Transactions are to be received as a comma separated string of elements example: '10d7ce2f43e35fa57d1bbf8b1e2, 2014-04-29T13:15:54, 10.00'
        transDate - the given date ignoring time
        treshHoldPrice - the threshhold price to identify fraud credit card transaction
        Returns:
        returns list of fraudelent credit card number as List of String
